title: Unique item
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, a **unique item** is one of four specific objects required to complete the game, which is listed under the "Unique Items" section in [discoveries](/wiki/Discoveries "Discoveries"):

- The [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation")
- The [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening")
- The [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead")
- The [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor")

## Generation

Each of the unique items appears in every game, since they are required to win, and cannot ever be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for as a result. If left in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"), they will revert to the following items:

- The Candelabrum of Invocation is replaced with a stack of [candles](/wiki/Candle "Candle").
- The Bell of Opening is replaced with a plain [bell](/wiki/Bell "Bell").
- The Book of the Dead is replaced with a [spellbook of blank paper](/wiki/Spellbook_of_blank_paper "Spellbook of blank paper").
- The Amulet of Yendor is replaced with a [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor").

## Description

Unique items are defined by having the field `oc_unique` set to 1 in [objects.c](/wiki/Objects.c "Objects.c") - while the unique items are also commonly referred to as **invocation artifacts**, they do not count towards the total of generated [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") for wishing purposes due to being guaranteed in each game. As they are necessary to win the game, unique items are indestructible (barring [bugs](/wiki/Bug "Bug")) and cannot be placed in [containers](/wiki/Container "Container").

Below is a table that lists each unique item, their effects and the item they revert to if left in bones:

| Artifact name                                                                            | Bones replacement                                                                                                                                          | Special properties |                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Obtaining                                                                        |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|                                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                            | Carried            | Used (worn, wielded, applied, or read)                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                  |
| [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor")                            | [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor") | many               | Find [endgame](/wiki/Endgame "Endgame") portals. Sacrifice to win the game!                                                                                                                                                 | Obtained from the [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") of Moloch.      |
| [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening")                               | [bell](/wiki/Bell "Bell")                                                                                                                                  |                    | [Invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual"). [Detect secret doors and traps](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection"). [Opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening"). | Obtained from your [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis").         |
| [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead")                            | [spellbook of blank paper](/wiki/Spellbook_of_blank_paper "Spellbook of blank paper")                                                                      |                    | [Invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual"). [Tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"). [Raise the dead.](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead#Raising_the_dead "Book of the Dead")                  | Obtained from the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"). |
| [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation") | stack of [candles](/wiki/Candle "Candle")                                                                                                                  |                    | [Invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual"). Radius 4 [light](/wiki/Light "Light").                                                                                                                    | Obtained from [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler").     |

### Unique items versus artifacts

Starting with [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), all [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") are also unique within a given game, but are not the same as unique items - they are specially named variants of their [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") with additional benefits, and appear as named versions of those items when unidentified. Some artifacts have a base item that exists mostly or exclusively for the generation of that artifact - e.g., most games will have no more than one [runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword") or [tsurugi](/wiki/Tsurugi "Tsurugi"), as those items never generate randomly and only appear when [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") or the [Tsurugi of Muramasa](/wiki/Tsurugi_of_Muramasa "Tsurugi of Muramasa") (respectively) are generated; it is still possible to have multiples of each item, though this typically requires wishing for them or else finding a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file containing artifacts that have already generated elsewhere in the game.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Unique item

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, a unique item is one of four specific objects required to complete the game, which is listed under the "Unique Items" section in discoveries:

  • The Candelabrum of Invocation
  • The Bell of Opening
  • The Book of the Dead
  • The Amulet of Yendor

Generation

Each of the unique items appears in every game, since they are required to win, and cannot ever be wished for as a result. If left in bones, they will revert to the following items:

  • The Candelabrum of Invocation is replaced with a stack of candles.
  • The Bell of Opening is replaced with a plain bell.
  • The Book of the Dead is replaced with a spellbook of blank paper.
  • The Amulet of Yendor is replaced with a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor.

Description

Unique items are defined by having the field oc_unique set to 1 in objects.c - while the unique items are also commonly referred to as invocation artifacts, they do not count towards the total of generated artifacts for wishing purposes due to being guaranteed in each game. As they are necessary to win the game, unique items are indestructible (barring bugs) and cannot be placed in containers.

Below is a table that lists each unique item, their effects and the item they revert to if left in bones:

Artifact name Bones replacement Special properties Obtaining
Carried Used (worn, wielded, applied, or read)
Amulet of Yendor cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor many Find endgame portals. Sacrifice to win the game! Obtained from the high priest of Moloch.
Bell of Opening bell Invocation ritual. Detect secret doors and traps. Opening. Obtained from your quest nemesis.
Book of the Dead spellbook of blank paper Invocation ritual. Tame undead. Raise the dead. Obtained from the Wizard of Yendor.
Candelabrum of Invocation stack of candles Invocation ritual. Radius 4 light. Obtained from Vlad the Impaler.

Unique items versus artifacts

Starting with NetHack 3.0.0, all artifacts are also unique within a given game, but are not the same as unique items - they are specially named variants of their base item with additional benefits, and appear as named versions of those items when unidentified. Some artifacts have a base item that exists mostly or exclusively for the generation of that artifact - e.g., most games will have no more than one runesword or tsurugi, as those items never generate randomly and only appear when Stormbringer or the Tsurugi of Muramasa (respectively) are generated; it is still possible to have multiples of each item, though this typically requires wishing for them or else finding a bones file containing artifacts that have already generated elsewhere in the game.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Unique_item&oldid=170560"
